page.title: 18Sparham Fund Raising
page.content: The Old Schoolis by the church, when the number of children diminished it was no longer economic to keep it open. Negotiations are in progress for it to be bought by the parish to be converted into a village hall, with the addition of a new kitchen and toilets. This would provide a much needed venue for social functions. In November 1985, for instance, it has been found necessary to hold the Christmas Bazaar in the back of the Church, though some people disapprove. Money is raised for the Church repairs and expenses and various good causes by means of a Summer Fete and Christmas Bazaar, coffee mornings and jumble sales. A sponsored cycle ride this summer attracted 9 riders who raised a total of Â£334 for the Norfolk Churches Trust, half of which went to St. Mary's Church.
